title: Pragmatic Comparison Analysis of Alternative Option Pricing Models. (arXiv:2309.09890v1 [q-fin.PR])
abstract: In this paper, we price European Call three different option pricing models, where the volatility is dynamically changing i.e. non constant. In stochastic volatility (SV) models for option pricing a closed form approximation technique is used, indicating that these models are computationally efficient and have the same level of performance as existing ones. We show that the calibration of SV models, such as Heston model and the High Order Moment based Stochastic Volatility (MSV) is often faster and easier. On 15 different datasets of index options, we show that models which incorporates stochastic volatility achieves accuracy comparable with the existing models. Further, we compare the In Sample and Out Sample pricing errors of each model on each date. Lastly, the pricing of models is compared among three different market to check model performance in different markets. Keywords: Option Pricing Model, Simulations, Index Options, Stochastic Volatility Models, Loss Function this http URL

Title: Pragmatic Comparison Analysis of Alternative Option Pricing Models. (arXiv:2309.09890v1 [q-fin.PR])
Abstract: In this paper, we price European Call three different option pricing models, where the volatility is dynamically changing i.e. non constant. In stochastic volatility (SV) models for option pricing a closed form approximation technique is used, indicating that these models are computationally efficient and have the same level of performance as existing ones. We show that the calibration of SV models, such as Heston model and the High Order Moment based Stochastic Volatility (MSV) is often faster and easier. On 15 different datasets of index options, we show that models which incorporates stochastic volatility achieves accuracy comparable with the existing models. Further, we compare the In Sample and Out Sample pricing errors of each model on each date. Lastly, the pricing of models is compared among three different market to check model performance in different markets. translated_title: 替代期权定价模型的实用比较分析
translated_abstract: 本文对动态变化的波动率进行了三种不同的期权定价模型的欧式看涨期权定价，其中使用了闭合形式的近似技术，表明这些模型在计算效率上与现有模型具有相同的性能水平。我们展示了诸如Heston模型和基于高阶矩的随机波动率（MSV）的SV模型的校准通常更快更容易。在15个不同的指数期权数据集上，我们展示了包含随机波动率的模型达到了与现有模型相当的准确性。此外，我们比较了每个模型在每个日期上的样本内误差和样本外定价误差。最后，比较了三个不同市场中模型的定价以检验其在不同市场中的性能。
tldr: 本文通过对动态波动率进行欧式看涨期权定价的实证研究，展示了包含随机波动率模型的计算效率和性能与现有模型相当，并对不同市场中模型的定价性能进行了比较。
en_tdlr: This paper presents an empirical study on pricing European Call options with dynamically changing volatility, demonstrating that models incorporating stochastic volatility have comparable computational efficiency and performance to existing models. The study also compares the pricing performance of these models across different markets.
